label: Demand Planning & Forecasting
description: AI-powered demand forecasting with external signal integration and multi-horizon planning achieving 30-50% improvement in forecast accuracy.

traditionalApproach.description: Spreadsheet-based forecasting using historical averages with manual adjustments
characteristics: Historical average as baseline forecast
Manual adjustments based on buyer intuition
Limited external signal consideration
Promotional lift estimated using last year's data
Monthly forecast refresh cycle
Forecast accuracy high error
constraints: Historical averages miss trend changes
Manual adjustments subjective and inconsistent
Misses external signals (weather, events, competitors)
Promotional forecasts highly inaccurate
Monthly refresh too slow for agile supply chain
New products difficult to forecast (no history)

contextualConstraints.content: Retailers struggle with demand forecasting for seasonal products, leading to overstock of winter coats in summer or stockouts of trending items during viral social media moments.
Grocery chains face challenges forecasting demand for perishable items, where manual methods fail to account for weather impacts on produce sales or promotional cannibalization.
Travel companies cannot accurately forecast demand spikes from major events or weather disruptions, leading to missed revenue opportunities or overbooking scenarios.
QSR operators struggle with forecasting demand for limited-time menu items, where manual adjustments fail to capture social media buzz or competitor promotions.
Hotels face forecasting challenges for group bookings and events, where manual methods miss the impact of economic indicators or local market conditions.

agenticApproach.description: AI-driven demand forecasting with machine learning, external signals, and continuous refinement
characteristics: ML models learn from historical patterns and trends
External signal integration (weather, events, social trends)
AI promotional lift modeling using similar campaign data
New product forecasting using analogous item patterns
Daily demand sensing for short-term accuracy
Continuous model retraining and accuracy improvement
benefits: External signals improve accuracy for weather-sensitive items
Better new product forecasts reduce stockouts/excess
Daily sensing enables agile inventory adjustments
Reduced safety stock needs save working capital

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on ML models learning from patterns and external signals']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on AI promotional lift modeling using similar campaigns']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on improved forecast accuracy reducing safety stock needs']

quickWins: Implement ML forecasting for top 20% of SKUs
Integrate weather data for seasonal categories
Deploy daily demand sensing for fast-moving items
prerequisites: Demand planning platform with ML capability
Historical sales data (2-3 years at SKU-store-day level)
Promotional calendar and historical lift data
Integration with inventory and replenishment systems

label: Inventory Optimization & Allocation
description: AI-driven inventory optimization with multi-echelon planning and dynamic allocation achieving 20-35% reduction in inventory while maintaining service levels.

traditionalApproach.description: Rule-based min/max inventory levels with static safety stock calculations
characteristics: Static min/max inventory levels set annually
Safety stock = fixed % of forecast or lead time * demand
Equal allocation across stores regardless of demand
Manual monitoring of slow-moving items
Reactive replenishment based on stock thresholds
Limited multi-echelon optimization (DC vs store independent)
constraints: Static safety stock over/under stocks items (excess or stockouts)
Equal allocation causes overstocks in low-demand stores
Slow-moving items tie up working capital
Reactive replenishment creates bullwhip effect
Siloed DC vs store optimization suboptimal
Service levels inconsistent

benchmarks.source: TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Inventory service level benchmarks']
TBD: [SME to provide source, e.g., 'Inventory composition benchmarks']

agenticApproach.description: AI-powered dynamic inventory optimization with demand-driven allocation and continuous refinement
characteristics: Dynamic safety stock based on forecast accuracy and lead time variability
Demand-driven allocation (high-demand stores get priority)
Multi-echelon optimization (DC + store network)
Automated slow-moving detection and markdown triggers
Proactive replenishment based on demand signals
Service level differentiation by item importance
benefits: In-stock rate improvement on A items
Automated slow-mover detection frees working capital
Multi-echelon optimization reduces total network inventory

projections.basis: TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on dynamic safety stock and multi-echelon optimization']
TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on demand-driven allocation and proactive replenishment']

TBD: [SME to provide logical basis, e.g., 'Based on multi-echelon optimization vs siloed DC/store optimization']

quickWins: Implement dynamic safety stock for top categories
Deploy demand-driven allocation for seasonal items
Enable automated slow-mover detection and alerts
prerequisites: Inventory optimization platform or advanced supply chain planning system
Historical sales, forecast accuracy, and lead time data
Defined service level policies by item class

label: Warehouse Management Systems (WMS)
description: AI-powered warehouse operations with intelligent slotting, dynamic routing, and labor optimization achieving 30-50% improvement in warehouse productivity.

traditionalApproach.description: Manual warehouse operations with static slotting and paper-based picking
characteristics: Static slotting based on product category (not velocity)
Manual wave planning and pick list generation
FIFO pick sequences (not optimized for travel)
Manual task assignment to warehouse staff
Annual or quarterly cycle counts
First-come first-serve dock scheduling
constraints: Static slotting puts slow movers in prime locations
Manual wave planning takes time
Inefficient pick paths waste picker time
Manual task assignment creates unbalanced workloads
Infrequent cycle counts yield lower accuracy
Dock congestion from unscheduled arrivals

characteristics: AI slotting based on velocity, affinity, and seasonality
Automated wave planning optimized for throughput and SLA
Dynamic pick path optimization (shortest path algorithms)
Intelligent task assignment balancing workload and skills
Perpetual inventory with RFID and AI-driven cycle counting
Automated dock scheduling with time slot optimization
benefits: Automated wave planning saves time daily
Inventory accuracy improvement with perpetual counts
Optimized dock scheduling reduces wait times

Manual freight invoice audit and payment

Static contracts miss spot market opportunities
Manual rate shopping limited to 2-3 carriers
Poor shipment visibility frustrates customers
Reactive exception handling delays resolution
Freight audit errors cost percentage of freight spend

Customers drop off returns (no pickup)
Manual route reconciliation and performance tracking
constraints: Static routes inefficient (empty miles)
Broad delivery windows frustrate customers
Limited visibility creates customer anxiety
Manual exception handling delays resolution
Returns require customer effort (trip to store/drop-off)
High cost per delivery
